verses.verse: Then answered <WH6030> <WH8799> Zophar <WH6691> the Naamathite <WH5284>, and said <WH559> <WH8799>,
Should not the multitude <WH7230> of words <WH1697> be answered <WH6030> <WH8735>? and should a man <WH376> full of talk <WH8193> be justified <WH6663> <WH8799> ?
Should thy lies <WH907> make <WH2790> men <WH4962> hold their peace <WH2790> <WH8686>? and when thou mockest <WH3932> <WH8799>, shall no man make thee ashamed <WH3637> <WH8688> ?
For thou hast said <WH559> <WH8799>, My doctrine <WH3948> is pure <WH2134>, and I am clean <WH1249> in thine eyes <WH5869>.
But <WH199> oh that <WH5414> <WH8799> 'Elohim <WH433> would speak <WH1696> <WH8763>, and open <WH6605> <WH8799> his lips <WH8193> against thee;

And that he would shew <WH5046> <WH8686> thee the secrets <WH8587> of wisdom <WH2451>, that they are double <WH3718> to that which is <WH8454> ! Know <WH3045> <WH8798> therefore that 'Elohim <WH433> exacteth <WH5382> <WH8686> of thee less than thine iniquity <WH5771> deserveth.
Canst thou by searching <WH2714> find out <WH4672> <WH8799> 'Elohim <WH433>? canst thou find <WH4672> <WH8799> out 'El SHaddai <WH7706> unto perfection <WH8503> ?
It is as high <WH1363> as heaven <WH8064>; what canst thou do <WH6466> <WH8799>? deeper <WH6013> than SH'ol <WH7585>; what canst thou know <WH3045> <WH8799> ?
The measure <WH4055> thereof is longer <WH752> than the earth <WH776>, and broader <WH7342> than the sea <WH3220>.
If he cut off <WH2498> <WH8799>, and shut up <WH5462> <WH8686>, or gather together <WH6950> <WH8686>, then who can hinder <WH7725> <WH8686> him?
For he knoweth <WH3045> <WH8804> vain <WH7723> men <WH4962>: he seeth <WH7200> <WH8799> wickedness <WH205> also; will he not then consider <WH995> <WH8709> it ?
For vain <WH5014> <WH8803> man <WH376> would be wise <WH3823> <WH8735>, though man <WH120> be born <WH3205> <WH8735> like a wild ass's <WH6501> colt <WH5895>.
If thou prepare <WH3559> <WH8689> thine heart <WH3820>, and stretch <WH6566> <WH8804> out thine hands <WH3709> toward him;
If iniquity <WH205> be in thine hand <WH3027>, put it far away <WH7368> <WH8685>, and let not wickedness <WH5766> dwell <WH7931> <WH8686> in thy tabernacles <WH168>.
For then shalt thou lift up <WH5375> <WH8799> thy face <WH6440> without spot <WH3971>; yea, thou shalt be stedfast <WH3332> <WH8716>, and shalt not fear <WH3372> <WH8799>:
Because thou shalt forget <WH7911> <WH8799> thy misery <WH5999>, and remember <WH2142> <WH8799> it as waters <WH4325> that pass away <WH5674> <WH8804>:
And thine age <WH2465> shall be clearer <WH6965> <WH8799> than the noonday <WH6672>; thou shalt shine forth <WH5774> <WH8799>, thou shalt be as the morning <WH1242>.
And thou shalt be secure <WH982> <WH8804>, because there is <WH3426> hope <WH8615>; yea, thou shalt dig <WH2658> <WH8804> about thee, and thou shalt take thy rest <WH7901> <WH8799> in safety <WH983>.
Also thou shalt lie down <WH7257> <WH8804>, and none shall make thee afraid <WH2729> <WH8688>; yea, many <WH7227> shall make suit <WH2470> <WH8765> unto thee <WH6440>.

But the eyes <WH5869> of the wicked <WH7563> shall fail <WH3615> <WH8799>, and they shall not escape <WH6> <WH8804> <WH4498>, and their hope <WH8615> shall be as the giving up <WH4646> of the ghost <WH5315>.
